newsitem.title: USA: BPA cuts Friday peak, firm power prices by $2/MWh.
newsitem.headline: BPA cuts Friday peak, firm power prices by $2/MWh.

text.p: The Bonneville Power Administration (BPA) continued to offer 150 megawatts (MW) of peak firm power for Friday pre-schedulings, but lowered prices by $2.00 per megawatt hour (MWh), the agency said Thursday.
BPA offered next-day peak firm power at $16.00 per MWh and $18.00 for California-Oregon (COB) sales.
BPA also continued to offer non-firm power during off-peak hours at unchanged prices.
Friday sales for all deliveries during hours ending ending 0100-0500 and 2400 PDT were steady at $8.00 per MW.
Non-firm power at hours ending 0600 and 2300 on Friday was also unchanged at $10.00, while prices for hours ending 0700-0800 were steady $13.00 per MWh for Northwest sales and $14.00 for COB.
